Brother to brother

1 Si, Lucane, tibi uel si tibi, Tulle, darentur

qualia LedaeiLedaeus, -a, -um, adj.: of or belonging to Leda, Ledaean fata LaconesLaco, -onis, m.: Laconian, Lacedaemonian, Spartan habent,

nobilis haec esset pietatis rixarixa, -ae, f.: quarrel, dispute duobus,

quod pro fratre mori uellet uterque prior,

5diceret infernas et qui prior isset ad umbras:

‘Vive tuo, frater, tempore, vive meo.’
content.question: What aspect of pietas is being shown in line 6 (Vive . . . meo) ?
